Intensify.Definition (Cambridge automatic): to become greater , more serious , or more extreme , or to make something do this:

Graph.Definition: visual representation of data using lines or bars
Graph.Definition (Cambridge automatic): a picture that shows how two sets of information or variables (= amounts that can change) are related , usually by lines or curves :

Remarkable.Definition (Cambridge automatic): unusual or special and therefore surprising and worth mentioning :

Shooting.Definition (Cambridge automatic): the act of shooting bullets from guns or other weapons :

Trend.Definition: general direction in which it is developing
Trend.Definition (Cambridge automatic): a general development or change in a situation or in the way that people are behaving :

Overwhelmingly.Definition: in an extremely great or powerful way

Fan.Definition: person who supports and admires them
Fan.Definition (Cambridge automatic): someone who admires and supports a person , sport , sports team , etc.:

Beneficiaries.Definition (Cambridge automatic): a person or group who receives money , advantages , etc. as a result of something else :

Leisure.Definition: free time or time for relaxation and enjoyment
Leisure.Definition (Cambridge automatic): the time when you are not working or doing other duties :

Poverty.Definition: the state of being extremely poor
Poverty.Definition (Cambridge automatic): the condition of being extremely poor :

Ancestors.Definition: people from whom we are descended, like grandparents or great-grandparents
Ancestors.Definition (Cambridge automatic): a person related to you who lived a long time ago:

Sustainable.Definition: capable of being maintained over a long period
Sustainable.Definition (Cambridge automatic): able to continue over a period of time :

Pollution.Definition: presence of harmful substances in the environment
Pollution.Definition (Cambridge automatic): damage caused to water , air , etc. by harmful substances or waste :

Drastic.Definition (Cambridge automatic): ( especially of actions ) severe and sudden or having very noticeable effects :

Viable.Definition: able to work successfully or feasibly
Viable.Definition (Cambridge automatic): able to work as intended or able to succeed :

Eerily.Definition: in a strange, mysterious, or unnatural way

Cited.Definition: quoted or mentioned as a reference
Cited.Definition (Cambridge automatic): to mention something as proof for a theory or as a reason why something has happened :

Sought.Definition (Cambridge automatic): past simple and past participle of seek

Redefine.Definition (Cambridge automatic): to change the meaning of something or to make people think about something in a new or different way:

Niche.Definition (Cambridge automatic): a job or position that is very suitable for someone, especially one that they like:

Gathering.Definition (Cambridge automatic): a party or a meeting when many people come together as a group :

Collapse.Definition (Cambridge automatic): to fall down suddenly because of pressure or having no strength or support :

Shrink.Definition (Cambridge automatic): to become smaller , or to make something smaller :

Switch.Definition: change or exchange one thing for another
Switch.Definition (Cambridge automatic): a small device , usually pushed up or down with your finger , that controls and turns on or off an electric current :

Consign it to the history books.Definition: consider it as a thing of the past, no longer relevant

Side note.Definition (Cambridge automatic): a note at the side of the text on a document , in a book , etc.:

Prosperity.Definition: the state of being successful and thriving
Prosperity.Definition (Cambridge automatic): the state of being successful and having a lot of money :

Momentum.Definition (Cambridge automatic): the force that keeps an object moving :

Mainstream.Definition (Cambridge automatic): considered normal , and having or using ideas , beliefs , etc. that are accepted by most people :

Cornerstone.Definition: the most important and fundamental part

Keen.Definition (Cambridge automatic): very interested , eager , or wanting (to do) something very much:

Peaked.Definition (Cambridge automatic): A peaked hat has a peak at the front :

Peak.Definition: reach the highest level or point

Keep our fingers crossed.Definition: hope for a positive outcome while waiting for news

Breakthrough.Definition (Cambridge automatic): an important discovery or event that helps to improve a situation or provide an answer to a problem :

Mitigate.Definition (Cambridge automatic): to make something less harmful , unpleasant , or bad :

Radically.Definition: in an extreme or drastic way

Transhumanism.Definition: a movement that supports the use of technology to enhance human capabilities and lifespans

Nonsense.Definition: meaningless or absurd talk or ideas
Nonsense.Definition (Cambridge automatic): an idea , something said or written, or behaviour that is silly or stupid :

Drastically.Definition: in a severe or extreme manner

Fundamentally.Definition: at the most basic or essential level

Sake.Definition (Cambridge automatic): in order to help or bring advantage to someone:

Venture capitalist.Definition: investor who provides funding to startup companies and small businesses

Web browser.Definition (Cambridge automatic): a computer program that makes it possible for you to read information on the internet

Institutions.Definition (Cambridge automatic): a large and important organization , such as a university or bank :

Divergence.Definition (Cambridge automatic): the situation in which two things become different:
